common_issues.title: Pieces OS Bugs: Selection Lock, High Resource Usage, Context Reset
common_issues.description: Users report persistent selection lock, preventing normal interaction.  High RAM/CPU usage spikes also occur, potentially linked to internet connectivity.  Restarting Pieces OS is a temporary workaround.  Auto-generated context settings revert to "Medium" despite user changes.

related_issues.title: it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
related_issues.text:
it doesnt stop selecting, it seems like "shift" or "mouse 1" is locked
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.3.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I'm not sure how to make it happen but its **extremely** annoying, it seems like it thinks I'm holding "shift" or "mouse 1", i use the arrow keys a lot but when this bug is active it selects instead of moving, when i try to click when its active it also selects, i cant ctrl + v when its active :(

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
related_issues.text:
Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Platform MacOS Version 15.5 (Build 24F74)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello!

This is an issue that I've seen happen in all of the builds since I've started using pieces. When changing the Auto-Generated Context (Saved Material Enrichment) option in Machine Learning from the menu, in my case I want it to be "High", but every time I change it, when I check the next day or any time later, or every time the app or os updates, the option selected goes back to "Medium". So I don't actually even know if it ever used "High", because it always returns the option to "Medium".
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Errors and Unexpected Behavior
common_issues.description: Users report issues with PiecesOS, including high RAM/CPU usage, failure to generate workstream summaries, and auto-generated context settings reverting to default.  The workstream summary and high resource usage issues appear related to a 404 error accessing the Gemini-Pro model. A temporary solution for high resource usage is restarting PiecesOS.  The auto-generated context setting issue is persistent across macOS platforms and multiple builds.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and extensions have compatibility issues
common_issues.description: Users report various compatibility issues between Pieces OS, its extensions (like Raycast), and different operating systems (macOS, Windows). Problems include Raycast extension incompatibility with newer Raycast versions, auto-generated context settings reverting to default, and failure to generate workstream summaries.  Check for updates for Pieces OS, the extension, and the OS itself. Ensure compatibility between versions and report issues with details for reproduction.

related_issues.title: Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast
related_issues.text:
Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast


### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Raycast Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

As mentioned on Discord, it appears that the Raycast needs to be updated to be compatible with (at least) the current version of Raycast 1.100.3. Trying to use any of the extension's functions triggers an error saying:

> Your Pieces Raycast Extension needs to be updated,...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/506778e6-5b13-4811-a21c-82c42384cb41)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Pieces OS Bugs: Selection Lock, High Resource Usage, Context Reset" issue, focusing on the persistent selection lock and high resource usage impacting Windows users.
Investigate the 404 error related to the Gemini-Pro model affecting workstream summary generation and potentially contributing to high resource usage.
Address the auto-generated context settings reverting to default across macOS and potentially other platforms.
Update the Raycast extension for compatibility with the latest Raycast versions.
Improve communication with users regarding known issues and temporary workarounds, especially concerning high resource usage and selection lock.
Monitor and address the remaining open tickets, especially those with high activity levels.
